Page 1 of 2 Range: All Created Date Range: All Created Time Range: All Author: All Department: All Resident Name : MULHALL, REGINALD (00877) Location : Ground W116 1 Admission 03/25/2021 Date : (R18), Hyperosmolality and hypernatraemia(E87.0), Atrial fibrillation, unspecified(I48.90), Peripheral vascular disease, unspecified(I73.9), Wernicke's encephalopathy(E51.2) Type of Behaviour : physical aggression initiated by resident Antecedent/Triggers : unable to leave the building Describe the behaviour : @ 2215 on May 31st, staff came to writer to let her know that he would be taking the resident outside. Writer told him the resident isn't allowed to leave the unit but can go to the balcony if he wants some air. Resident happened to be there when writer was talking to staff. He became upset and started using inappropriate words on staff and writer and threatened to destroy everything in the unit. He started throwing things on the floor. First was the vital sign machine then he grabbed the unit fan he was about throwing that on the floor when one of the male staff got hold of the fan before it could get to the floor. Writer called a code white and other unit supervisors came to the floor to help. He was yelling and screaming that he wants to go home . He doesn't want to live here anymore. he said " I have lived here for more than five years, I need to go home". At this point, redirection couldn't help. The nurse in-charge called the nurse manager on call and she asked writer to call resident POA, maybe that would help calm him down. Writer called the POA and explain the situation to him. POA asked to speak with him. They both spoke for some minutes and he became calm. POA gave him his brother's number to call as resident has been requesting for it. resident waited for some time at the door to see if anyone would come in so he can leave. After some minutes he went to sit at the balcony. Resident was awake till 0300 wandering around the unit looking for an exit route. No unit/facility property was damaged. no physical injuries incurred by staff or resident. Disruptiveness (Data)/Consequences to the behaviour : throwing unit properties Interventions (review/update care plan) (Action) : code white initiated POA informed nurse manager informed nurse in-charge aware. redirection was unsuccessful Change in medication : n/a What are the risks and causes : n/a Outcome(s)(Result) : resident became calm after speaking to his son Substitute Decision Maker notified (if not, explain) : yes ________________ SIGNED] Page 2 of 2 Range: All Created Date Range: All Created Time Range: All Author: All Department: All Resident Name : NEWMAN, PHYLLIS (001034) Location : Ground W104 1 Admission 11/02/2023 Date : Malignant hypertension(I10.1)
